intro: Correa reflexa var. speciosa, commonly known as the showy correa, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its attractive, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in shrubland and coastal habitats, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and evergreen, providing a lush backdrop to its showy blooms. It is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in coastal conditions.
